content.description: Sit start matched on a good crimpy sloper under the belly of the boulder with a sweet left heel hook, pull up and slap to slopers and fight your way to the top.
content.location: On the back side of slab city, to the left of pyramid potion.

content.description: Sit start with left hand high on the arete and right hand on the blank face, fight a barn door and make a cool move to a 2 finger pocket on the face. From there use a lot of core and some fancy foot work to top her out. If you're having a hard time getting of the ground then just do the stand, it's well worth it and probably a v3!
content.location: The left arete of the Milestone boulder

content.description: Sit start matched on the arete and some technical body positioning will allow you to climb up the pyramid with ease. Awesome triangular feature for the finish.
content.location: This will be the left face of slab city, one of the first problems you'll see, hard to miss!

content.description: Climb the face of the pyramid side of the slab city boulder
content.location: One of the first lines you'll see, adjacent the huge slab wall, the somewhat left side face climb right next to "pyramid potion"

content.description: The name says it all, sit start far left with a left heel hook and left hand on the sloper lip, right hand in a massive undercling. I'm usually not a huge fan of traverses but this one surprised me with how fun it really was, climbed way differently than I had imagined.
content.location: On the back side of the Milestone

content.description: Sit start the Milestoned Arete but on the right side, pull up to some crimps and slab your way to the top up and right. There is a good crimp far out right.
content.location: On the Milestone, this climbs the face just to the right of the Milestoned Arete

content.description: Sit start with right hand on the arete and left hand on the blank face, pull up, match the arete and find a way to the top!
content.location: This is the striking right arete of The Milestone, impossible to mistake

content.description:
Monster lowball. Sit start with a sick left hand perfect incut crimper and rh on some bs sidepull. Mega right dropknee, hit a rh crimp around the bulge (or gaston). Then massive (crux) stand up move to a sloper, match and desperate awkward mantle to glory. Classic. 

  I'd give this V3-V7 if I could because it's completely height dependent for the crux move.
content.location: This is on the backside of the slab city boulder. If you are looking at Pyramid Potion, this is around the corner to the left, look for the little cave bulge thing (to the left of Start Diggin V3)

content.description: Another sloper traverse, neighboring "painless traverse", it's a little easier and not as good in my opinion. Sit start at the right end of the boulder and traverse left, it felt more natural to mantle immediately so that took some value away. Finishing move is pretty unique though!
content.location: The adjacent slopey left side of the climb "painless traverse", on back end of the Milestone boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on a jug, I ended up having my right heel matched as well, above my right hand. Make a big move out left to a flat textured rail, a couple more compression moves then you just gotta top her out. Sweet moves on cool holds I just wish it was further off of the ground.
content.location: Back left side of Milestone boulder, almost the same top out as for  "painless traverse", it's the left prow if you're looking at "break on through"

content.description: Awesome over hanging right to left traverse, sit start far right and ride the slopers to an exciting move near the end!
content.location: The obvious overhanging traverse on the brick boulder

content.description: Sit start the prow of the brick boulder and dyno to the slopey lip. Short and powerful massive lowball.
content.location: Obvious prow of the brick boulder

content.description: Same start position as for "riders on the storm", except after pulling off of the ground make a hard match on the arete, then break on through to the other side of the boulder and climb it on the adjacent blank face and arete. Pretty core intensive  compression line that ended up being way harder than I thought it was going to be. Again, if the sit start feels impossible, I'd say try a little harder or just do it from the stand, it's fun!
The direct mantle of "free throw", make one or two moves out left and you're Scott free.
Sit start matched on a rail below the lip, pull on and slap to slopey jugs then mantle up on a cool step.
content.location: The left direct line of "free throw"

content.description: I stumbled across these three boulders while heading to the Sherman boulder. I couldn't' believe how dirty they were for how close they are to the round pond boulders. There are 3 moderate sized boulders right in a row with some classic moderate climbs and potential for a few real hard ones.
